23CSE A58 SHAILESH BABU S R   DATE:    /    /2025  
EX NO: 02 
CREATION  AND  MODIFICATION  OF TABLES  USING 
DDL COMMANDS  
 
AIM :  
To create  a database  for the application  of LIBRARY management  system  database  using  
the below  schema using DDL Commands in ORACLE.Also,to modify the existing table 
structure and to  drop the table.  
 
SCHEMA  DIAGRAM:  
 
 
 
 
 
DATA  DICTIONARY:  
 
1. LIBRARY Tabl e
 
 
 
 
23CSE A58 SHAILESH BABU S R    
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
2. BOOKS Table   
 
23CSE A58 SHAILESH BABU S R    
PROCEDURE : 
Creation  and modification  of Tables  using  ORACLE:  
 
❖ Create  the table  using  the command  
 
CREATE TABLE LIBRARY (  
    "LIBRARY_ID" CHAR(10),  
    "NAME" VARCHAR2(100),  
    "LOCATION" VARCHAR2(100),  
    PRIMARY KEY ("LIBRARY_ID")  
); 
 
CREATE TABLE BOOKS (  
    "BOOK_ID" CHAR(10),  
    "TITLE" VARCHAR2(100),  
    "AUTHOR" VARCHAR2(50),  
    "LIBRARY_ID" CHAR(10),  
    PRIMARY KEY ("BOOK_ID"),  
    FOREIGN KEY ("LIBRARY_ID") REFERENCES LIBRARY("LIBRARY_ID")  
); 
 
 
 
❖ Insert  data into the records  of the table  using  the command  
 
INSERT INTO LIBRARY (library_id, name, location) VALUES ('L001', 
'Central Library', 'Downtown');   
INSERT INTO LIBRARY (libra ry_id, name, location) VALUES ('L002', 
'City Library', 'Uptown');   
 
INSERT INTO BOOKS (book_id, title, author, library_id) VALUES 
('B001', 'Oracle DB', 'John Doe', 'L001');   
INSERT INTO BOOKS (book_id, title, author, library_id) VALUES 
('B002', 'SQL Basi cs', 'Jane Smith', 'L002');   
INSERT INTO BOOKS (book_id, title, author, library_id) VALUES 
('B003', 'Advanced SQL', 'Robert Brown', 'L001');  
 
 
 23CSE A58 SHAILESH BABU S R    
 
Truncate Table:             
 
 TRUNCATE TABLE  BOOKS;  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
Drop Table:                
 
 DROP TABLE  BOOKS;
23CSE A58 SHAILESH BABU S R    23CSE A58 SHAILESH BABU S R   Delete the table including the structure using Dropping the 
table entirely table_name;  
 
 
 
 
❖ Delete only the data inside the table retaining back the structure using Removing data 
but keeping table structure table_name;  
 
23CSE A58 SHAILESH BABU S R    
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
RECORD  RUBRICS : 
 
PARAMETERS  MARKS  
Perfection in Design/Queries (10)  
Completion (05)  
Neatness (05)  
Prompt  Timing  (05)  
Total  (25)  
RESULT:  
The database  for the schema  of an Airbnb  System  has been created  using  the DDL 
commands in ORACLE.

for

Airbnb
 
Rental
 
System
 
using
 
tools
 
like
 
Dia/draw .io
 
etc..
 
 
SPECIFICATION:
 
          
This
 
application
 
aims
 
to
 
computerize
 
the
 
operations
 
of
 
an
 
online
 
property
 
rental
 
platform.
 
Features
 
include
 
managing
 
property
 
listings,
 
booking
 
accommodations,
 
and
 
handling
 
transactions
 
for
 
both
 
property
 
owners
 
and
 
travelers.
 
 
Property
 
Owners
 
(Hosts):
 
●
 
Can
 
update
 
property
 
details,
 
including
 
availability ,
 
pricing,
 
and
 
amenities.
 
●
 
Can
 
respond
 
to
 
booking
 
requests
 
and
 
manage
 
confirmed
 
bookings.
 
Travelers
 
(Guests):
 
●
 
Can
 
search
 
for
 
properties
 
based
 
on
 
location,
 
price,
 
and
 
amenities.
 
●
 
Can
 
make
 
booking
 
requests
 
and
 
confirm
 
stays
 
at
 
listed
 
properties.
 
Both
 
Hosts
 
and
 
Guests:
 
●
 
Can
 
view
 
property
 
details
 
and
 
booking
 
statuses.
 
 
REQUIREMENTS
 
ANALYSIS:
 
 
Entities
 
Identified:
 
●
 
Host
 
●
 
Guest
 
●
 
Properties
 
●
 
Booking
 
●
 
Payment
 
 
Entities
 
Identified:
 
●
 
Owns
 
●
 
Views
 
●
 
Booked
 
●
 
Bill
